  5. Glaril

Glaril is larger than Ipadora Sanctuary but less peaceful, less orderly, and considerably more interesting to those who operate in the gray spaces between law and lawlessness. Where the Sanctuary is the kingdomâ€™s ideal, Glaril is its reality: a massive, sprawling underwater city with the full complexity of a large population, limited enforcement capacity, and a geographic position that makes it the natural transit hub for anything moving through Ipadora waters.

The Ipadora family faction that governs Glaril is a branch of the royal family â€” governing is an inherited administrative role, and the current branch is competent administrators who have made peace with their inability to control the cityâ€™s waterfront. The Glaril waterfront is piracyâ€™s home, not in the romantic sense but in the functional sense: ships that come through Ipadora water routes pass near enough to Glaril that organized theft from maritime cargo is a stable economic activity.

Rabuka (#4 Arashi) lives in Glaril by origin and still maintains a residence here. He is Sharkai â€” a shark-person â€” and in Glaril, among the Ipadora and the waterfront population, he is known not as an Arashi member but as a talented fighter who grew up well. His reputation in Glaril is local, personal, and complicated. His reputation outside Glaril is the reason organizations with resources send experienced people before they send anyone else.

Rose maintains a diplomatic post. No other surface organization has managed to establish a stable presence.
